cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.IR. 

The paper proposes a novel formulation for paper matching in the peer review process, which involves optimization algorithms and fairness constraints. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) or Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories, as these fields often involve optimization and algorithmic approaches. Additionally, the paper deals with issues of workload balancing and expertise matching, which are relevant to the Data Structures (cs.DS) and Social and Information Networks (cs.SI) sub-categories. Finally, the paper mentions the use of a relaxation technique and a flow-based algorithm, which are commonly used in Information Retrieval (cs.IR).
